study is like rowing upstream – if you don't keep pushing forward, you fall behind
pinyin: xue2 ru2 ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4
containing_words.word: 学如逆水行舟，不进则退

definition: like rowing a boat upstream, if you stop moving forward you fall back (idiom)
pinyin: ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4

sentences.english: Time flows with the current, life sails against the current.
sentences.chinese: 时间顺流而下，生活逆水行舟。

sentences.english: Life is boating against the current.
sentences.chinese: 生活是逆水行舟，不进则退。

sentences.english: You felt the floor, a pole slacken qianhe back.
sentences.chinese: 逆水行舟用力撑，一篙松劲退千寻。

definition: like rowing a boat upstream, if you stop moving forward you fall back (idiom)

definition: against the current/upstream
to sail against the current/(fig.) to go against the flow
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
lit. ninety li is merely a half of a hundred li journey (idiom)/fig. the closer one is to completing a task, the tougher it gets/a task is not done until it's done

definition: see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
to mark time (military)/to make no headway
to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
